page.title: 05Foresters Golf Club
page.content: Construction of the family owned golf club began in 1969 on 40 acres of former farming land. The club was opened in 1975. It is a nine hole golf course and with thirty three bunkers. The longest hole is five hundred and seven yards the shortest is one hundred and forty yards. Three hundred and ten members and four thousand visitors play each year. The club has a professional player who teaches golf every Friday. The green keeper Mr John O 'shea keeps the grass in good condition, cutting it three times a week. Children can join. Clubs can be hired out and about one thousand balls are bought each year. There are eight, full time employees. The club house was a former barn. This can be hired out for social functions. The club is open from dawn to dusk all year round.
